metadata.name: Cedar to Describo generated profile
metadata.description: Generated Describo schema from a Cedar template

inputs.name: Release_Date
inputs.label: Release Date
inputs.help: The date upon which all the submissions in this metadata form will be made publicly visible by NCBI. If this field is empty, submissions will be released immediately. (Note that release of an SRA submission also forces the release of referenced BioSample submission entries, and in turn release of the referenced BioProject.)

inputs.name: Study_ID
inputs.label: Study ID
inputs.help: Permanent identifier for each study (Example: 'PRJNA349')

inputs.name: Study_Title
inputs.label: Study Title
inputs.help: Descriptive study title (Example: 'Effects of sun light exposure of the Treg repertoire')

inputs.name: Study_Type
inputs.label: Study Type
inputs.help: Generic study design (Example: 'Controlled clinical trial'

inputs.name: Study_Criteria
inputs.label: Study Criteria
inputs.help: List of criteria for inclusion/exclusion for the study (Example: 'Include: Clinical P. falciparum infection; Exclude: Seropositive for HIV')

inputs.name: Contact_Information
inputs.label: Contact Information
inputs.help: Full name and other relevant contact information of the corresponding author for this dataâthat is, the person who is legally responsible for data collection and release. (Example: 'Peter Stibbons, +1-987-654-3210')

inputs.name: Contact_Email
inputs.label: Contact Email
inputs.help: Email address of the corresponding author for this dataâthat is, the person who is legally responsible for data collection and release. This email will be used as the account name which has access to this data record in NCBI.

inputs.name: Lab_Name
inputs.label: Lab Name
inputs.help: Department of corresponding author responsible for data collection (Example: 'Department of Planar Immunology')

inputs.name: Lab_Address
inputs.label: Lab Address
inputs.help: Institutional address of corresponding author responsible for data collection (Example: 'School of Medicine, Unseen University, Ankh-Morpork, Disk World')

inputs.name: Relevant_Publications
inputs.label: Relevant Publications
inputs.help: Publications describing the rationale and/or outcome of the study, using PubMed or other persistent globally unique identifiers (Example: 'PMID85642')

inputs.name: Sample_Name
inputs.label: Sample Name
inputs.help: Sample Name is a name that you choose for the sample. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. Every Sample Name from a single Submitter must be unique.

inputs.name: Sample_Title
inputs.label: Sample Title
inputs.help: Title of the sample

inputs.name: Organism
inputs.label: Organism
inputs.help: Binomial designation of experimental subject's species (Example: 'Homo sapiens')

inputs.name: Isolate
inputs.label: Isolate
inputs.help: identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained (Example: 'SUB856413')

inputs.name: Age
inputs.label: Age
inputs.help: Age at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees. Provide the SI unit after the value (Examples: '65 years', '23 weeks', '15 days', '3.2 seconds'))

inputs.name: Biomaterial_Provider
inputs.label: Biomaterial Provider
inputs.help: name and address of the lab or PI, or a culture collection identifier

inputs.name: Sex
inputs.label: Sex
inputs.help: Physical sex of sampled organism (Example: 'Female')

inputs.name: Tissue
inputs.label: Tissue
inputs.help: The actual tissue sampled, e.g. lymph node, liver, peripheral blood (Example: 'Bone marrow')

inputs.name: Cell_Line
inputs.label: Cell Line
inputs.help: Name of the cell line of the sample, or from which the sample was obtained. (Example: HEK293)

inputs.name: Cell_Type
inputs.label: Cell Type
inputs.help: Type of cell of the sample or from which the sample was obtained. (Example: PBMC)

inputs.name: Cell_Subtype
inputs.label: Cell Subtype
inputs.help: Sub type of cell of the sample or from which the sample was obtain (Example: 'B cell')

inputs.name: Culture_Collection
inputs.label: Culture Collection
inputs.help: Name of source institute and unique culture identifier. See the description for the proper format and list of allowed institutes, http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-culturecollection-qualifier. Format is Value format: "<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]<culture_id>" (Example: 'ATCC:26370')

inputs.name: Development_Stage
inputs.label: Development Stage
inputs.help: Developmental stage at the time of sampling (Example: '1 day after inoculation')

inputs.name: Disease
inputs.label: Disease
inputs.help: List of diseases diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. Select from Disease Ontology (https://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/DOID/?p=classes). (Example: 'adrenal medulla carcinoma, myeloid sarcoma')

inputs.name: Disease_Stage
inputs.label: Disease Stage
inputs.help: Stage of disease at the time of sampling.

inputs.name: Ethnicity
inputs.label: Ethnicity
inputs.help: IHMC code for ethnicity of the subject, integer or text (Examples: 01=Hispanic or Latino or Spanish, 02=Non-Hispanic or Non-Latino or Non-Spanish)

inputs.name: Health_State
inputs.label: Health State
inputs.help: Health or disease status of sample at time of collection

inputs.name: Karyotype
inputs.label: Karyotype
inputs.help: The number and visual appearance of the chromosomes in the cell nuclei of an organism or species.

inputs.name: Phenotype
inputs.label: Phenotype
inputs.help: Phenotype of sampled organism.

inputs.name: Population
inputs.label: Population
inputs.help: The full, unabbreviated population descriptor from the Coriell Institute

inputs.name: Race
inputs.label: Race
inputs.help: Racial group of subject (as defined by NIH) (Examples: 'White', 'American Indian or Alaska Native', 'Black', 'Asian', 'Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander', 'Other')

inputs.name: Sample_Type
inputs.label: Sample Type
inputs.help: Sample type, such as cell culture, mixed culture, tissue sample, whole organism, single cell, metagenomic assembly

inputs.name: Treatment
inputs.label: Treatment
inputs.help: Description of the treatment protocol for the subject from whom this sample was obtained

inputs.name: Sample_Description
inputs.label: Sample Description
inputs.help: Description of the sample

inputs.name: Sample_Name_sra
inputs.label: Sample Name Sra
inputs.help: BioSample Accession or Sample Name assigned by submitter, unique within study. This needs to match the Sample Name in the corresponding BioSample entry. (Example: 'SUP52415')

inputs.name: Library_ID
inputs.label: Library ID
inputs.help: Short unique identifier for the sequencing library. Each Library ID MUST be unique! (Example: 'Homo-sapiens-UTSoM-T19273')

inputs.name: Title
inputs.label: Title
inputs.help: Short description that will identify the dataset on public pages. A clear and concise formula for the title is of the form:  {methodology} of {organism}: {sample info}  (Example: `RNA-Seq of mus musculus: adult female spleen`)

inputs.name: Library_Strategy
inputs.label: Library Strategy
inputs.help: Sequencing strategy used in the experiment (Example: 'RNA-Seq')

inputs.name: Library_Source
inputs.label: Library Source
inputs.help: Type of genetic source material sequenced in the experiment (Example: 'Metagenomic')

inputs.name: Library_Selection
inputs.label: Library Selection
inputs.help: Method of selection or enrichment used in the Experiment (Example: 'RANDOM-PCR')

inputs.name: Library_Layout
inputs.label: Library Layout
inputs.help: Number, order, orientation, and distance of associated reads (Example: '2 Kbp paired ends')

inputs.name: Platform
inputs.label: Platform
inputs.help: Designation of sequencing instrument used (Example: 'Alumina LoSeq 1000')

inputs.name: Instrument_Model
inputs.label: Instrument Model
inputs.help: Model identifier of the instrument used to perform the sequencing. Acceptable instrument models may be viewed at https://sramongo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/sraConstants.html#instrument-models. (Examples: 'Illumina HiSeq 2000', '

inputs.name: Design_Description
inputs.label: Design Description
inputs.help: Free-form description of the methods used to create the sequencing library; a brief 'materials and methods' section.

inputs.name: Optional_SRA_Attribute
inputs.label: Optional SRA Attribute-Value
inputs.help: Enter the name of the optional attribute, followed by the value of that attribute. Add additional attributes as needed.

inputs.name: File_Type
inputs.label: File Type
inputs.help: Type of the raw data file. Must be one of the acceptable file types, including bam, sra, kar, srf, sff, fastq, tab, 454_native, Helicos_native, SOLiD_native_csfasta, SOLiD_native_qual, SOLiD_native, PacBio_HDF5, CompleteGenomics_native, bam_header, reference_fasta. For multiple files of different types, enter one File Type per file, separated by commas.

inputs.name: File_Name
inputs.label: File Name
inputs.help: Enter the name of the raw data file into the Value field of each attribute-value pair. Each name must match the name of a file selected for upload. (The attributes are automatically named as 'filename1', 'filename2', etc..)

inputs.name: Template_Annotations
inputs.label: Template Annotations
inputs.help: An overview of this template, with an optional field for user notes.

inputs.name: User_Annotations
inputs.label: User Annotations
inputs.help: Enter any notes you wish to make about this metadata instance (e.g., how it was created, any open questions, or notes for the historical record.) The information will not be included with your submission to NCBI.
